title: DirectView Holdings to Present at the SeeThruEquity Fall Microcap Investor Conference
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: DirectView Holdings, Inc. 
NEW YORK, Sept. 4, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- DirectView Holdings, Inc. ( DIRV ) ("DirectView" or the "Company"), a company focused on ownership and management of leading video and security technology companies, today announced that the Company will present at the SeeThruEquity Fall Microcap Conference in New York City on Thursday, September 10, 2015. The conference will be held at Convene Grand Central, 101 Park Avenue, New York, NY. 
In a 30-minute presentation, DirectView Holdings CEO, Roger Ralston, will showcase the Company and its and its unique security applications including the soon to be released DVXG1000 body-worn-camera solution for the law enforcement and private security markets. Mr. Ralston will also attend 1-on-1 meetings with scheduled investors. The conference allows for networking with a variety of attendees including institutional investors, equity research analysts, private client brokers, and the media. 
Roger Ralston, CEO and Board Chairman of DirectView, said, "This conference is an outstanding opportunity for us to connect with investors, institutions, and members of the brokerage community who are looking for exciting opportunities in the fast growing market for security and surveillance. We are look forward to demonstrating the functionality of our new body-worn camera solution as well as our unique positioning for building DirectView's growing security and surveillance business." 
About DirectView Holdings, Inc. 
DirectView Holdings, Inc., together with its subsidiaries, provides video surveillance solutions and teleconferencing products and services to businesses and organizations. The company operates in two divisions, Security (Video Surveillance) and Video Conferencing. The Security division offers technologies in surveillance systems providing onsite and remote video and audio surveillance, digital video recording, and services. It also sells and installs surveillance systems; and sells maintenance agreements. The company sells its products and services in the United States and internationally through direct sales force, referrals, and its Websites. The Video Conferencing division offers teleconferencing products and services that enable clients to conduct remote meetings by linking participants in geographically dispersed locations. It is involved in the sale of conferencing services based upon usage, the sale and installation of video equipment, and the sale of maintenance agreements. This division primarily provides conferencing products and services to numerous organizations ranging from law firms, banks, high tech companies and government organizations. For more information visit our website at www.DirectView.com and connect with us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Google+.
